Articles.Content:
Tbh, the thing isn't there anymore? but since i read somewhere that the boulder moves around randomly i guess that might be it.

For the coordinates, wait a moment i'll look it up

EDIT: Duna Mapsat #1 says the coordinates are -30.6 N -28.8 E.... so yeah it's somewhere around there.

EDIT2: Bing! sudden realization the anomaly shown by mapsat is not on the ground (where i have been searching) but instead in the air

wow i'm stupid^^

Well, I would like know what is supposed to be in there... the Curiosity arm? I found nothing yet, I tried for hours!

And a question to Nova: Why there are two volcanoes in Moho, exactly opposite each other? Is it related to the true path to find the Magic Boulder?

The only two red spots corresponds to the volcanoes that are opposite each other.

Moho have an area that is always lit, which I call "iluminate face" that has a gradient of approximately 120 Ã‚Âº. This side is the highest volcano, which I call for now "Olimpus", while on the opposite side, "dark face" is the other volcano, I call for now "Hades".

Edited October 2, 2012 by MOhon

Well, I would like know what is supposed to be in there... the Curiosity arm? I found nothing yet, I tried for hours!

And a question to Nova: Why there are two volcanoes in Moho, exactly opposite each other? Is it related to the true path to find the Magic Boulder?

Well, I just visit those coordinates now and have not found anything, man.

Did you find anything there? "We aint found ****" (Spaceballs)

P.D: That guy found that Curiosity arm:

http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/showthread.php/20962-0-17-Easter-eggs?p=272206&viewfull=1#post272206

Where is it? ???

Edited October 2, 2012 by MOhon

What the hell is a boulder? Google transla... I mean, my english skills fail me.

(I only use google translate in extreme cases).

What the hell is a boulder? Google transla... I mean, my english skills fail me.

(I only use google translate in extreme cases).

Basically, a big rock.
a boulder, un rocher, petram, ein Fels and Ã«Â°â€Ã¬Å“â€ž
Have any of you tried landing on it? It's a very good way to reduce the delta-v necessary for transferring between planets.

Have any of you tried landing on it? It's a very good way to reduce the delta-v necessary for transferring between planets.

From which planet do you hop on it? Duna or Vall? I'm pretty sure i saw the boulder on Vall but i can't figure out the timing for when it comes around :/

What the hell is a boulder? Google transla... I mean, my english skills fail me.

(I only use google translate in extreme cases).

It's another way of saying 'large rock'.

What the hell is a boulder? Google transla... I mean, my english skills fail me.

(I only use google translate in extreme cases).

(another reply saying rock)

the Curiosity arm? I found nothing yet, I tried for hours!

Hint: its at the southeast corner of a large, round-ish plain on the edge between the plain and a small creator.

EDIT: How do you make Spoilers?!

Edited October 2, 2012 by 0jam3290
SPOILErS!!

Did you try to land on it?

Has anyone tried finding if it emits sound?
So that's what I saw when landing on Duna one day?
*foaming mouth* Must kill magic boulder by landing on it...

EDIT: How do you make Spoilers?!

[ Spoiler=NAME][/spoiler ] (no spaces)

I was orbiting Ike looking for the boulder earlier, apparently my orbit was too low and I crashed into a mountain

It does not emit any sound as far as I can tell. It's actually quite visible. Using two spacecraft, I estimate that I could still see in catch some light every now and then from about 140km away. It was just a solitary blinking pixel without any zoom.

Hint: its at the southeast corner of a large, round-ish plain on the edge between the plain and a small creator.

EDIT: How do you make Spoilers?!

Well, surely you mean the approximate coordinates -30.6 N -28.8 E, but I land in that point several and I found nothing.

Landed in Duna approximate coords -30.6 N -28.8 E

Please, Got a screenshot that shows it?

Vall Stonehenge!

Edited October 6, 2012 by MOhon
What are the "Stonehenge" coordinates?

What are the "Stonehenge" coordinates?

If you go to Vall (Jool moon), go to southern polar circle. This Easter Egg is visible about 15km altitude.

With ISAMap, you can find approximate coords.

Edited October 3, 2012 by MOhon

Well, surely you mean the approximate coordinates -30.6 N -28.8 E, but I land in that point several and I found nothing.

Landed in Duna approximate coords -30.6 N -28.8 E

Please, Got a screenshot that shows it?

Yeah, as i said. After a couple switches between spacecrafts it just vanished... Completely! that's why i assume that it moves to random positions in duna's atmosphere. I've got a couple more pictures of that thing, but you can't really make out what that thing really ist. But i'm sure it's not a graphic bug

Does anyone have more exact coordinates? I've scoured the area where the two craters meet for dozens of kilometers around with a rover, but I can't seem to find the darn camera mast.

so remember the movie "contact" wasnt there multiple sources of communication within one signal..... has anyone actually tried other decoding techniques?(sound, video).... to be honest this looks like a "we were here but we had to leave due to the volcanoes that possibly erupted and covered the planet in molten lava, but its cool we went to kerbin and now were your one eyed ancestors" type of sign. the geometric symbols in the upper left look like an exit trajectory, almost like the ones in the map view.

what i want to know is the secret behind stonehenge......

Here's a Mapsat with Coords

[ATTACH=CONFIG]34198[/ATTACH]

Nothing too!!

Please, I need a proof that there really!
